website_summaries.verdict: Between the rugged construction, incredibly user-friendly design, and dazzlingly impressive recording quality, Garmin’s VIRB 360° camera has it all, and if it’s in your budget, we wholeheartedly recommend it.
pros: Stabilizers ensure smooth video even when the camera is in motion
cons: As fantastic as this camera’s top resolution is, the 1 hr

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: We researched 360 cameras of all types and price ranges. This camera is the best bang for your buck. Its great quality, for the price you can't beat it. We tried a few 360 cameras that were inexpensive and they were disappointing. Most cameras beyond this were pushing out out of budget. This camera has great support for post production and that may be its best feature. There are some seams in the video but we set it up to work for us, made some adjustments in post, and the client was very happy with the end product. We're really happy with the choice and have zero regrets
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Mankovecky

customer_reviews.title: Worst 360 camera I've used
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Virb 360 has absolutely horrendous image quality and overheats very quickly. Images from any old cellphone look almost 5x as good as this.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this camera for the express purpose of being ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for the express purpose of being able to film training in my airplane and capture the associated audio. Since June of 2017 I have been trying to work with Garmin to get bluetooth audio to work. I have a trail of emails over the last nine months where I was promised the problem would be fixed ASAP, with the last one being recieved today 2/13/2017. I have repeatedly asked Garmin to buy the Camera back if they are not going to fix the issue, and of course they have refused. It states plainly in the manual that bluetooth audio capture should work , but yet it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for someone else for Christmas but they couldn't use it due to being very busy with other stuff already.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney H Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Stop recording after 5 min max. !! Very bad and unstable product !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera and I was very enthusiastic about it ... I bought 128 GB memory card so I can recode videos upto 2 hours ... when I tried to do that I was shocked that the camera is power reset after 5 mins of recording.... in the beginning, I thought that it factory defect on the product !! So I returned the product and I ordared a new one ... whoever , I found the same problem in the new camera when I receive it ... so the only thing I can say about it it is very low quality product and I don’t recommend or advise any one to buy it !!
customer_reviews.author: Sherif Lebdah

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as a Fiat... worked until return window expired.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Not gonna lie it was like pulling teeth to get in contact with customer service, but they have fixed/replaced the camera at no charge. I have updated the review to reflect them making it right. Original Review: Worked for about a month, and now having WiFi issues. I’ve preformed multiple factory resets, reformatted the SD card, and have done everything I know to get this to pair with my phone and it will not work. Only works about a third of the time. We use this for work to take progress photos. I am really disappointed with this product. When it actually works it’s amazing... but it doesn’t work so... I wish I could still return this.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Geo metrics on excellent 360 camera.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 360 camera. Love the ability to put geo metrics in the video. Would like it had a better way to mount it while running.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Towne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Love it. Too bad it does not interface with Google Streetview.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: VIRB360732
customer_reviews.text: Love my camera, probably my best acquisition in term of cameras yet
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than GoPro
customer_reviews.text: I have had EVERY generation of GoPro. THEY ALL SUCK compared to the Virb 360.
customer_reviews.author: James Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but would rather sell and replace with a Fusion
customer_reviews.text: Ok, but wish I had a GoPro Fusion instead. The stabilization in the GoPro software is much better, plus exporting stabilized clips is so much better. Garmin makes you edit clips into a project and then you export a stabilized stringout. The size of the Garmin is better.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Plate

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money for 360
customer_reviews.text: OVERPRICED Non Functional Junk! The device overheated and has failed to record anything.
customer_reviews.author: Luc

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the Virb 360
customer_reviews.text: This review is from a 45 year old. Very happy with the Virb 360. Easy to use, easy to set up just follow the directions. Do all your up dates right out of the gate. If you are going to use it in low light use the pro tune settings in the app for your phone. The software for the mac book pro is no good. All messed up. So don't even try to use it till Garmin updates it. Mounts are standard, battery is good for about an hour. Very happy with it, just needs to have the editing software updated.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Musser

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, but poor value.
customer_reviews.text: TDLR: Better options out there. Pros: Great build quality. Lenses are easily replaceable. Garmin Edit software is truly excellent. Metric overlays are great to have. Cons: Expensive. Poor picture quality. I have a GP Hero 7 and 6 Black. I know what 4K footage looks like. This is not close. Even 1080P looks better. I am quite disappointed by this. Short battery life. Most mounting options are neither stable nor secure. I like the camera but wouldn't have spent as much as I did had I known the pq would be as bad.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Relive it in VR!! Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the VIRB360 for roughly a year now. It is far and away a superior camera compared to my GoPro Hero 4. I use it for kayaking and use GoPro style mounts interchangeably. It does lack a loop for a tether so there is risk of it getting bumped off but otherwise it’s amazing. You can relive every experience in VR or create a multi angle movie as if you had multiple cameras mounted. Hands down an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: MrMiagee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, buggy software.
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware, the camera itself is solid and well built. Image quality among the best of consumer 360 cams. Audio is surprisingly good. That part is top notch. The rest goes downhill. The software is buggy, connection to the mobile app is slow and sometimes doesn't work. The camera advertises 5.7k with 4k stitched in camera. It delivers on the 4k very well, but overheats going for 5.7k. The mobile app and desktop software will get better, but right now they are kinda poor and tarnish the excellent hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Vispian

customer_reviews.title: Decent and versatile camera
customer_reviews.text: Decent and versatile camera. After several updates, it's now my most reliable prosumer 360 camera that I can use semi-professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Minh

customer_reviews.title: VIRB Mac Edit Software Non- Functional
customer_reviews.text: I received my camera this week and although the camera is great the software is not functional for Mac. The VIRB Mac Edit software cannot output the video for use locally, Facebook or Youtube, you get a scrambled mess. If you use the WIndows software, or the app it will work, but the Mac software is not functional currently. When they fix this I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: squid

product_meta.title: Garmin VIRB 360 Camera
product_meta.description: Built for any adventure, the Garmin VIRB 360 Camera is compact, lightweight, ultra-durable and waterproof, so you can capture everything you want, wherever you want, without fear of losing your data. The VIRB is easy to use and can be controlled anytime with the touch of a button or voice activation. 4K spherical stabilization ensures smooth, steady video. Review, edit and share from anywhere with the VIRB mobile app remote control, with live preview and live streaming capabilities. G-Metrix data overlay uses built-in sensors like GPS and GLONASS, barometer and accelerometer to provide data points to display on screen using premade templates to further enhance your video. Enhance your story and bring your videos to a whole new level with the Garmin VIRB 360.Features: 360 resolution up to 5.7K/30fps unstitched and 4K/30fps with in-camera stitching 4 built-in microphones captures true 360-degree audio 4K spherical stabilization ensures a smooth video regardless of camera movement Built-in sensors provide G-Metrix data overlays in 360-degree augmented reality Easy-to-use, free VIRB Mobile app and VIRB Edit desktop software let you edit, stabilize, share and add data overlays to videos Constantly record for more than 1 hour on 1 charge4 -- without overheating
feature_bullets: Resolution up to 5.7K/30fps with desktop stitching; 4K/30fps auto-stitched in-camera
Up to 15-megapixel resolution provides high-quality, spherical photos
HyperFrame Director Mode gives you the editing power to easily reframe content after filming — using smooth camera pans, incredibly wide angles and even tiny planets
Spherical stabilization ensures smooth video regardless of camera movement
Built-in sensors provide G-Metrix data overlays in 360-degree augmented reality
